title: Stakefast
author: Stakefast
created_time: January 01, 2023, 06:34:28 PMLast edit: January 01, 2023, 11:16:34 PM by Stakefast
content: PvKeys.comBTC & ETH Private Key FinderI want to represent you my newest fun-project called PvKeysIts about finding old bitcoin/ethereum adresses that may have some balance on them.We know the chance to find one is nearly impossible, we still like to collect cool btc and eth addies, such with names in them and more.More features such as a explorer of all keys, including a search for names will be added in the near future.We find it to be a gamble since you are using your time to generate adresses, its like a free scratch card.Try your luck   PvKeys.com

comments.author: bitcampaign
comments.body: I thought why waste time doing this because I believe it will only be a waste of time and anyone will not find free money there, but your idea is appreciated and to be honest it's not friendly on mobile browsers a bit slow to open your site , best of luck with this project

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: how do you calculate the balance and the received amount on each address? If it's an API call then it should have some limits...But it is an excellent project, it would be great if we could run it auto on random and collect all the private keys with balance, that would be a nice feature.Is not the first time I see a project like this, but is the first time I see it with that UI.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: Stakefast on January 01, 2023, 06:34:28 PMWe find it to be a gambleI find it to be a time-waster. Why would anyone use your site for watching cool-name address? They can generate their own vanity address.Quote from: seoincorporation on January 01, 2023, 10:30:13 PMand collect all the private keys with balance, that would be a nice feature.Collect ? Or steal ? Imo, posting keys of any btc address with a balance is pure stealing(scamming someone) for me. However, Im sure @OP hasnt got any.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: OP, I do not want to completely trash your project since it is not completely bad but I see some problems about it.For example, gambling is entertaining because it has a random pattern of loss and reward, and there is always a chance for both and in many cases the player can choose to sacrifice potential profit to increase the chances of winning, dice games are a good example of it. The point is to have a percentage of success which satisfies the gambler and I am afraid this percentage is so low that won't be suitable for the average person.Not even mentioning that this is basically brute-forcing other's keys, which is distasteful, to say the least. Just my two sats.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Wouldn't it be nice to filter out 0 bal addresses as well?

comments.author: fortunecrypto
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on January 02, 2023, 04:05:37 AMWouldn't it be nice to filter out 0 bal addresses as well?  The developer is the first that is going to benefit if he can do that he will wipe out all the wallets with a balance on them, this is totally waste of time you can do this for a month and your chances to get a wallet with a balance on it is nil, it will take you a year or more to finish all the pages.   there are thousands of trillions of pages on it this is the first page https://pvkeys.com/home?page=1and this is a random page https://pvkeys.com/home?page=701365966843345299404408742047443448752011079203365476907233015933280714762

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: Quote from: fortunecrypto on January 02, 2023, 06:15:29 AMQuote from: libert19 on January 02, 2023, 04:05:37 AMWouldn't it be nice to filter out 0 bal addresses as well?  The developer is the first that is going to benefit if he can do that he will wipe out all the wallets with a balance on them, this is totally waste of time you can do this for a month and your chances to get a wallet with a balance on it is nil, it will take you a year or more to finish all the pages.   there are thousands of trillions of pages on it this is the first page https://pvkeys.com/home?page=1and this is a random page https://pvkeys.com/home?page=701365966843345299404408742047443448752011079203365476907233015933280714762if you think about it, people should be smart like your thinking, of course OP has taken it first and benefited from it, I think making money this way is like looking for a needle in a haystack and playing gambling is much better than playing games like this

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on January 02, 2023, 01:24:13 AMQuote from: seoincorporation on January 01, 2023, 10:30:13 PMand collect all the private keys with balance, that would be a nice feature.Collect ? Or steal ? Imo, posting keys of any btc address with a balance is pure stealing(scamming someone) for me. However, Im sure @OP hasnt got any.Agreed. This is not gambling at all because this service is offering a hacking service to steal balance on somebody wallet. This kind of game assuming this will become successful will create negativity in Bitcoin since leaving your balance on your wallet address is not safe.Good thing that hacking a certain private key is almost impossible to occur. This is a illegal gambling imho because the user are committing a crime by using such service.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Stakefast on January 01, 2023, 06:34:28 PMPvKeys.comBTC & ETH Private Key FinderI want to represent you my newest fun-project called PvKeysIts about finding old bitcoin/ethereum adresses that may have some balance on them.We know the chance to find one is nearly impossible, we still like to collect cool btc and eth addies, such with names in them and more.More features such as a explorer of all keys, including a search for names will be added in the near future.We find it to be a gamble since you are using your time to generate adresses, its like a free scratch card.Try your luck   PvKeys.com    What is this website platform you gave OP? I don't understand if this is a casino game or what. But as far as I can see, this is not gambling, because other gambling games are seen, not yours.What is the point of this website platform? I don't get the theme of this project. Can you clarify a bit OP?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Not wanting to call the OP's project an entire duplicate, but the keys.lol site I guess long enough to appeal to some slackers at first before they realize it's nearly impossible to find even one funded address. Yep, there is no chance even for the hosts to "win" the game. This is not included in the category of gambling.

comments.author: Zwei
comments.body: holy shit I found one with a balance of 0.0420this is like emptying the ocean with a spoon, you may get lucky an finish it in a small infinity!

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on January 01, 2023, 10:30:13 PMhow do you calculate the balance and the received amount on each address? If it's an API call then it should have some limits...I did quick check using developer tools (F12 -> Network) on my browser and found out it use blockchain.info API. But since the API is called from our own browser, the limit should be based on your IP address.Quote from: AbuBhakar on January 02, 2023, 08:42:04 AMThis kind of game assuming this will become successful will create negativity in Bitcoin since leaving your balance on your wallet address is not safe.I disagree, this kind of service is a proof Bitcoin cryptography is secure and can't be brute forced.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on January 02, 2023, 01:24:13 AMQuote from: seoincorporation on January 01, 2023, 10:30:13 PMand collect all the private keys with balance, that would be a nice feature.Collect ? Or steal ? Imo, posting keys of any btc address with a balance is pure stealing(scamming someone) for me. However, Im sure @OP hasnt got any.Let them try. There will always be immoral people, and you can't stop them. But it doesn't matter to Bitcoin, and they won't find anything. Maybe it helps convince someone how secure Bitcoin is.Quote from: Hispo on January 02, 2023, 02:28:02 AMNot even mentioning that this is basically brute-forcing other's keys, which is distasteful, to say the least.You can barely call this brute-forcing. People are brute-forcing billions if not trillions of keys per second, OP's site is insignificant compared to them.It's kinda funny that the moral aspect of this comes up every time. It's not as if Bitcoin address generation is a secret. If you worry about brute-forcing, you shouldn't use Bitcoin. Or educate yourself.You know who else brute-forces Bitcoin addresses to check for their balance? YOU! Every time you install a new Electrum wallet, it brute-forces 20 addresses, and if they have any balance, it shows up in your wallet!

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on January 02, 2023, 12:17:14 PMQuote from: Edwardard on January 02, 2023, 01:24:13 AMQuote from: seoincorporation on January 01, 2023, 10:30:13 PMand collect all the private keys with balance, that would be a nice feature.Collect ? Or steal ? Imo, posting keys of any btc address with a balance is pure stealing(scamming someone) for me. However, Im sure @OP hasnt got any.Let them try. There will always be immoral people, and you can't stop them. But it doesn't matter to Bitcoin, and they won't find anything. Maybe it helps convince someone how secure Bitcoin is.That's right, the odds to find an address using this method are terribly low... I mean, click random and just see the link:https://pvkeys.com/home?page=1246048741711510860136015797123817644880737086897262811579349675196026978305even if the page decides to display 1,000,000 addresses each roll we will find nothing, because the number of private keys and addresses is just too big.From all the ways that I know for Bruteforce private keys, I could say this is the slowest one... there are some better tools like brainflayer.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: bitcampaign on January 01, 2023, 09:51:16 PMI thought why waste time doing this because I believe it will only be a waste of time and anyone will not find free money there, but your idea is appreciated and to be honest it's not friendly on mobile browsers a bit slow to open your site , best of luck with this projectIt might look like a waste of time and resources, but I think the motive behind this could be to claim any unclaimed forked coins on these old addresses that have happened over the years  I could be wrong and stand to be corrected. Quote from: Zwei on January 02, 2023, 10:48:33 AMholy shit I found one with a balance of 0.0420this is like emptying the ocean with a spoon, you may get lucky an finish it in a small infinity!I guess going through old crypto YouTube videos would be a great place to start

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on January 04, 2023, 11:38:08 AMQuote from: Woodie on January 03, 2023, 07:12:11 PMQuote from: bitcampaign on January 01, 2023, 09:51:16 PMI thought why waste time doing this because I believe it will only be a waste of time and anyone will not find free money there, but your idea is appreciated and to be honest it's not friendly on mobile browsers a bit slow to open your site , best of luck with this projectIt might look like a waste of time and resources, but I think the motive behind this could be to claim any unclaimed forked coins on these old addresses that have happened over the years  I could be wrong and stand to be corrected.It doesn't make sense since you can't guess/mathematically predict private key or range of private key based on old Bitcoin address or it's public key.I was thinking in the lines of OP maybe buying these so called cool addresses in the hope of getting the unclaimed coins as i have seen these kind of services, and not that some kind of brute force or private key cracker will be used. Sorry for the misunderstanding...

comments.author: digaran
comments.created_time: January 04, 2023, 05:16:49 PMLast edit: January 04, 2023, 05:30:31 PM by digaran
comments.body: Honestly last night I found 2 addresses each containing +400$, didn't touch them, also not going to say which coin.Helping to solve some puzzle transactions is good but if you find someone else's coins and take it for yourself, then you are a thief.Your site takes 10 sec to load a page, also no option to select page number.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on January 04, 2023, 05:16:49 PMHonestly last night I found 2 addresses each containing +400$, didn't touch them, also not going to say which coin.This is hard to believe, can you sign a message with both addys to prove the veracity of your story?The odds of finding one are really low and you say you found 2, easy $800 in 1 day. Sorry but for me, this is really hard to believe, and I'm sure no one else will find an address there with a balance in the next 10 years.I don't want to take the coins, just sign a transaction with the address  and it would be nice if you can make a small transaction to let the owner know how his address are now compromised.

comments.author: digaran
comments.created_time: January 05, 2023, 02:51:02 AMLast edit: January 06, 2023, 03:12:56 AM by digaran
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on January 04, 2023, 08:03:45 PMQuote from: digaran on January 04, 2023, 05:16:49 PMHonestly last night I found 2 addresses each containing +400$, didn't touch them, also not going to say which coin.This is hard to believe, can you sign a message with both addys to prove the veracity of your story?The odds of finding one are really low and you say you found 2, easy $800 in 1 day. Sorry but for me, this is really hard to believe, and I'm sure no one else will find an address there with a balance in the next 10 years.I don't want to take the coins, just sign a transaction with the address  and it would be nice if you can make a small transaction to let the owner know how his address are now compromised. Don't know how to sign a message with that coin, it's most used and trusted wallet banned my country, connecting with my mobile could trigger a fund freeze. And if you search the address online google will take you to a site where you could find keys for that specific blockchain.Btw, both addresses have the same amount of tokens worth more than $900, and they have no or very small gas or is it gwei? I don't know and don't care what they call it, lol.Well after a few hours searching found more shitcoins, don't know if this sig counts or not.Following addy has thousands of $ worth in shitcoins, I have seen so many dead tokens in the past few days that I feel saturated, lol.Quote{  "address": "0xcfcb12d849569a3d1cf971721665b2dce0279a91",  "msg": "0x4469672066726f6d20626974636f696e74616c6b2c206e6f7420746865206f776e65722c206a7 5737420666f756e64206974206f6e207468652077656220616e642077696c6c206e657665722074 6f7563682074686573652073686974746f6b656e73206f7220616e7920636f696e2f746f6b656e2 0746861742773206e6f74206d696e652e",  "sig": "f0842c11e60863ec78847b9f27fd2259e8a33cb7d9d8b947889afd691e7582a7413b22488149afe 0a0fa30683e1d6807a45cb8ceda5c8b2900d11051edea30ad1c",  "version": "3",  "signer": "MEW"}
